references.text: Hypocrisy, arrogance, pride, anger, harshness, and ignorance belong to one who is born for a demonic nature.
Let him not, even though in pain, speak words cutting others to the quick.
Learn the Truth by approaching a spiritual master. Inquire from him with reverence and render service unto him.
Revere your teacher as a god.
A man who has given a promise to another must fulfill it exactly as promised.
Truth is the foundation of righteousness.
Following such conclusions, the demoniac, who are lost to themselves and who have no intelligence, engage in unbeneficial, horrible works meant to destroy the world.
Austerity of speech consists in speaking words that are truthful, pleasing, beneficial, and not agitating to others.
Let him speak the truth, let him speak what is pleasing, let him not speak truth that is unpleasant.
A king who punishes thieves according to the law will gain fame in this world and unsurpassed bliss after death.
Theft is taking another's property without permission.
Nonviolence, truthfulness, freedom from anger, renunciation, tranquility, aversion to faultfinding...
When non-violence in speech, thought and action is established, one's aggressive nature is relinquished and others abandon hostility in one's presence.
